citation.article-title: Parasutterella excrementihominis gen. nov., sp. nov., a member of the family Alcaligenaceae isolated from human faeces
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Parasutterella (Pa.ra.sut.te.rel′la. Gr. prep. para besides, next to; N.L. fem. n. Sutterella name of a bacterial genus; N.L. fem. n. Parasutterella a genus similar to Sutterella).
Cells are Gram-negative, non-motile, strictly anaerobic, non-spore-forming cocci to coccobacilli.
Grow in the presence of bile.
Aesculin and gelatin are not hydrolysed and nitrate is not reduced.
The main respiratory quinones are MK-6 and MMK-6.
The only major fatty acid (>10 % of the total) is C18 : 1ω9c.
The type species is Parasutterella excrementihominis.
